glsa.title: Vixie Cron: Privilege Escalation
glsa.synopsis: Vixie Cron allows local users to execute programs as root.

background.p: Vixie Cron is a command scheduler with extended syntax over cron.

description.p: Roman Veretelnikov discovered that Vixie Cron fails to properly check whether it can drop privileges accordingly if setuid() in do_command.c fails due to a user exceeding assigned resource limits.

impact.p: Local users can execute code with root privileges by deliberately exceeding their assigned resource limits and then starting a command through Vixie Cron. This requires resource limits to be in place on the machine.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
